meanings.definition: Sibbs: plural noun meaning siblings or brothers and sisters.
meanings.sent1: My sibbs and I love playing together in the park.
meanings.sent2: She has three sibbs, two brothers, and a sister.
meanings.sent3: During family game night, my sibbs always team up against me!
meanings.sent4: The bond between sibbs is like a strong rope that can never be broken.
meanings.sent5: Growing up with my sibbs made every day an adventure.

meanings.definition: Sibbs: verb meaning to engage in playful or teasing banter with someone.
meanings.sent1: We sibbs back and forth, joking and laughing all day.
meanings.sent2: Friends often sibbs with each other to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent3: I sibbs with my best friend about who is the better cook.
meanings.sent4: Their banter sibbs like a lively dance, full of energy and joy.
meanings.sent5: Sibbing with my siblings always brings a smile to my face.

meanings.definition: Sibbs: adjective meaning related by blood or family ties.
meanings.sent1: We have a sibbs bond that can never be broken.
meanings.sent2: The family reunion was a gathering of all our sibbs relatives.
meanings.sent3: It's always nice to spend time with sibbs family members.
meanings.sent4: The sibbs connection between us is like a thread weaving through generations.
meanings.sent5: The sibbs love in our family is the strongest force in the world.
